verses.verse: But David said, “My brethren, you shall not do so with what the LORD has given us, who has preserved us and delivered into our hand the troop that came against us.
For who will heed you in this matter? But (Deut. 13:13; Judg. 19:22) as his part is who goes down to the battle, so shall his part be who stays by the supplies; they shall share alike.”
So it was, from that day forward; he made it a statute and an ordinance for Israel to this day.
Now when David came to Ziklag, he sent some of the spoil to the elders of Judah, to his friends, saying, “Here is a present for you from the spoil of the enemies of the LORD”—
to those who were in Bethel, those who were in (Num. 31:27; Josh. 22:8) Ramoth of the South, those who were in (Josh. 19:8) Jattir,
those who were in (Josh. 15:48; 21:14) Aroer, those who were in (Josh. 13:16) Siphmoth, those who were in (1 Chr. 27:27) Eshtemoa,
those who were in Rachal, those who were in the cities of (Josh. 15:50) the Jerahmeelites, those who were in the cities of the (1 Sam. 27:10) Kenites,
those who were in (Judg. 1:16; 1 Sam. 15:6; 27:10) Hormah, those who were in Chorashan, those who were in Athach,

those who were in (Num. 14:45; 21:3; Josh. 12:14; 15:30; 19:4; Judg. 1:17) Hebron, and to all the places where David himself and his men were accustomed to (Num. 13:22; Josh. 14:13-15; 21:11-13; 2 Sam. 2:1) rove.
The Tragic End of Saul and His Sons Now (1 Sam. 23:22) the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell slain on Mount (1 Chr. 10:1-12) Gilboa.
Then the Philistines followed hard after Saul and his sons. And the Philistines killed (1 Sam. 28:4) Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua, Saul’s sons.
(1 Sam. 14:49; 1 Chr. 8:33) The battle became fierce against Saul. The archers hit him, and he was severely wounded by the archers.

(2 Sam. 1:6) Then Saul said to his armorbearer, “Draw your sword, and thrust me through with it, lest (Judg. 9:54; 1 Chr. 10:4) these uncircumcised men come and thrust me through and abuse me.” But his armorbearer would not, (Judg. 14:3; 1 Sam. 14:6; 17:26, 36) for he was greatly afraid. Therefore Saul took a sword and (2 Sam. 1:14) fell on it.
